amendment.description: Amendment prohibits the use of funds to enter into a contract with any offeror that has been convicted of misconduct such as theft, forgery, bribery, or violating Federal criminal tax laws.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 21 printed in the Congressional Record to prohibit the use of funds to enter into a contract with any offeror that has been convicted of misconduct such as theft, forgery, bribery, or violating Federal criminal tax laws.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Grayson amendment (A058) Agreed to by voice vote.
